Class NoteAPI

java.lang.Object
controllers.NoteAPI
public class NoteAPI extends Object
The responsibility of the NoteAPI class is to manage a collection (ArrayList) of Note objects.

Each Note may contain zero or many Item objects. The NoteAPI provides:

  • CRUD operations for managing notes (add, update, delete).
  • Methods for archiving notes based on specific conditions (e.g., all items completed).
  • Counting methods to retrieve information about how many notes/items meet various conditions (e.g. number of active or archived notes, number of items completed).
  • Listing methods to display notes or items based on various conditions, such as category, priority, and item completion state.
  • Searching methods to find notes by title or items by description.
  • Persistence methods to save and load notes from an XML file using XStream.

Purpose:

  • Provide a central API for working with Note objects and their associated Item objects.
  • Enforce validation rules with notes (e.g. index validation, category validation through CategoryUtility).
  • Support persistence.

  • Constructor Details

    • NoteAPI

      public NoteAPI()

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add(Note note)
      Adds a Note object to the notes collection.
      Parameters:
      note - note to add
      Returns:
      true if the Note was successfully added, false otherwise

    • updateNote

      public boolean updateNote(int indexToUpdate, String noteTitle, int notePriority, String noteCategory)
      Updates an existing Note at the passed index with new details for title, priority, and category. If the index is invalid, returns false. Otherwise, updates the note and returns true.
      Parameters:
      indexToUpdate - index of the note to update
      noteTitle - new title for the note
      notePriority - new priority for the note (1 to 5)
      noteCategory - new category for the note (one of the valid categories)
      Returns:
      true if the update was successful; false if the update fails

    • deleteNote

      public Note deleteNote(int indexToDelete)
      Deletes the Note at the specified index, if valid. Also deletes all Item objects associated with that note (cascading delete needed for
      invalid reference 
      NoteAPITest
      ). If the index is valid, deletes the Note and returns the deleted Note. Otherwise, returns null.
      Parameters:
      indexToDelete - index of the note to delete
      Returns:
      the deleted Note if successful,null otherwise.

    • archiveNote

      public boolean archiveNote(int indexToArchive)
      Tries to archive a Note at the given index.
      • Index must be valid.
      • Note must not be already archived.
      • All items in the note must be completed.
      If all above conditions are met, note is archived and true is returned, otherwise false.
      Parameters:
      indexToArchive - index of the note to archive
      Returns:
      true if the note was successfully archived, false otherwise

    • archiveNotesWithAllItemsComplete

      public String archiveNotesWithAllItemsComplete()
      Archives all active notes that have all items completed.
      • If no active notes exist, returns "No active notes stored".
      • If active notes exist and some are archived by this operation, returns a string of newly archived notes.
      • If active notes exist but none are eligible for archiving, returns "No active notes eligible for archive".
      Returns:
      a message with the archiving result

    • numberOfNotes

      public int numberOfNotes()
      Returns number of notes currently stored.
      Returns:
      total number of notes

    • numberOfArchivedNotes

      public int numberOfArchivedNotes()
      Returns number of archived notes
      Returns:
      number of archived notes

    • numberOfActiveNotes

      public int numberOfActiveNotes()
      Returns number of active notes
      Returns:
      number of active notes

    • numberOfNotesByCategory

      public int numberOfNotesByCategory(String category)
      Returns number of notes belonging to the passed category. Only counts the notes if the passed category is valid.
      Parameters:
      category - category to filter notes by
      Returns:
      number of notes in the specified category

    • numberOfNotesByPriority

      public int numberOfNotesByPriority(int priority)
      Returns number of notes with specified priority. Priority must be in range 1 to 5.
      Parameters:
      priority - priority to filter notes by
      Returns:
      number of notes with specified priority

    • numberOfItems

      public int numberOfItems()
      Returns total number of items
      Returns:
      total number of items

    • numberOfCompleteItems

      public int numberOfCompleteItems()
      Returns total number of completed items
      Returns:
      total number of completed items

    • numberOfTodoItems

      public int numberOfTodoItems()
      Returns total number of items that are not completed, i.e. to-do
      Returns:
      total number of items that are not completed, i.e. to-do

    • listAllNotes

      public String listAllNotes()
      Lists all notes in a friendly format, including index. If no notes exist, returns "No notes stored".
      Returns:
      formatted string of all notes or "No notes stored"

    • listActiveNotes

      public String listActiveNotes()
      Lists all active notes If no active notes exist, returns "No active notes stored".
      Returns:
      a formatted string of active notes or "No active notes stored"

    • listArchivedNotes

      public String listArchivedNotes()
      Lists all archived notes If no archived notes exist, returns "No archived notes stored".
      Returns:
      a formatted string of archived notes or "No archived notes stored"

    • listNotesBySelectedCategory

      public String listNotesBySelectedCategory(String category)
      Lists all notes belonging to a category.
      • If no notes exist, returns "No notes stored".
      • If notes exist but none for the given category, returns "No notes with category [category]".
      • If notes exist for the category, returns a formatted list of those notes, including the total.
      Parameters:
      category - the category to filter by
      Returns:
      a formatted string of notes in that category or the appropriate message if none relevant

    • listNotesBySelectedPriority

      public String listNotesBySelectedPriority(int priority)
      Lists all notes with a given priority.
      • If no notes exist, returns "No notes stored".
      • If notes exist but none match the given priority, returns "No notes with priority [1-5]".
      • If notes exist for the priority, returns a formatted list of those notes, including the count.
      Parameters:
      priority - the priority to filter by [1 to 5]
      Returns:
      a formatted string of notes matching the priority or relevant message if none found

    • listTodoItems

      public String listTodoItems()
      Lists all items that are not completed ([TODO]).
      • If no notes or no to-do items exist, returns "No notes stored".
      • Otherwise returns a list of to-do items, prefixed by note title.
      Returns:
      a formatted string of all to-do items or "No notes stored"

    • listItemStatusByCategory

      public String listItemStatusByCategory(String category)
      Lists completion status of items for a given category Shows both completed and TODO items, along with totals
      • If no notes exist, returns "No notes stored".
      • If the category is invalid or no items match, returns "No notes with category [category]".
      • Otherwise returns a formatted string including totals and lists of completed and TODO items.
      Parameters:
      category - category to filter items by
      Returns:
      a formatted string with completion status of items for the given category

    • findNote

      public Note findNote(int index)
      Finds and returns a Note by its index if valid, otherwise returns null.
      Parameters:
      index - index of the note to find
      Returns:
      Note at the given index or null

    • searchNotesByTitle

      public String searchNotesByTitle(String searchTitle)
      Searches for notes by title.
      • If no notes stored, returns "No notes stored".
      • Otherwise returns a list of notes whose title contains the given search string.
        • If none found, returns "No notes found for: X".
      Parameters:
      searchTitle - title substring to search for
      Returns:
      a formatted string of matching notes or an appropriate message if none found

    • searchItemByDescription

      public String searchItemByDescription(String searchItemDescription)
      Searches for items by description
      • If no notes stored, returns "No notes stored".
      • Otherwise, returns a list of items whose description contains the given search string.
      • If none found, returns "No items found for: X".
      Parameters:
      searchItemDescription - the description substring to search for
      Returns:
      a formatted string of matching items or an appropriate message if none found

    • isValidIndex

      public boolean isValidIndex(int index)
      Checks if provided index is valid for the notes collection.
      Parameters:
      index - index to validate
      Returns:
      true if index is within the valid range; false otherwise

    • load

      public void load() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Loads the notes from an XML file ("notes.xml") into the notes ArrayList using XStream and DomDriver. Relevant classes added to avoid security warnings. This method was taken from lecture notes.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue reading the file
      ClassNotFoundException - if the classes are not found

    • save

      public void save() throws Exception
      Saves the current notes ArrayList to an XML file ("notes.xml") using @link XStream} and DomDriver. Relevant classes added to avoid security warnings. This method was taken from lecture notes.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the save
